content.question: According to a recent survey, 47.9 percent of housing units in a large city are rentals. A sample of 210 housing units will be randomly selected. Which of the following must be true for the sampling distribution of the sample proportion of housing units in the large city that are rentals to be approximately normal?

choices.label: The distribution of the population must be approximately normal.
The sample size must be greater than 30.
The sample size must be less than 10 percent of the size of the population.

The values of <math alttext="210 times 0.479" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>210</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.479</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="210 times 0.521" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>210</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.521</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> must be at least 10.

The value of <math alttext="the square root of the fraction 0.479 times 0.521 over 210" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>0.479</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.521</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>210</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> must be at least 10.

content.answer: The values of <math alttext="210 times 0.479" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>210</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.479</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="210 times 0.521" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>210</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.521</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> must be at least 10.
